intro: Valeriana deltoidea, commonly known as delta valerian, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and typically grows in moist, wooded areas. The plant features opposite, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered white or pinkish flowers. Its roots are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their sedative properties. Valeriana deltoidea is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
